column1: wide outside off, nipping off the seam from back of a length, dabbed into the covers to get promptly off the mark
tighter line, straightens off the pitch, left alone
drawn forward on an off-stump line, a threat of movement off the seam but comfortably negotiated
wider line, no stroke needed
outside off, tapped out to point
defensive prod to cover, and a bit of a stuttering single as the fielder swooped round. Broad opts out of the shy, it could have been tight if he'd done so
back of a length, angled in, defended back down the pitch
slower ball, fuller length, pushed back to the bowler
a fraction short, but a tight line on off stump. Blocked off the back foot to the bowler
into line once again and blocked
wider outside off, and through to the keeper
through to the keeper to complete a tidy but unchallenging maiden
off-stump line to the left-hander, met with a cautious block on the back foot, bat and pad together
fuller length, attacking the pads, squirted off a leading edge into the covers

edged and dropped! And it's Cook again! His third in two games. A fuller length, that familiar curling full length, kissing off the edge and floating low but very catchable to first slip! clips the heels of the hands and bobbles up and away. Whoops
edged again, and Stokes in the gully swoops heroically but on the bounce
careful now! Brathwaite has a nibble outside off, and nearly feathers the nick
straighter line, tucked to the leg side to complete an eventful over
round the wicket, outside the left-hander's off stump. Ignored
banging at the door outside off
lifting through to the keeper but still no stroke needed
nips off the seam but from a wide line
through to the keeper once again
inducker to the left-hander, a threatening line with late movement but squeezed to safety with bat and pad together
curling length, tapped to point
through to the keeper, swinging across the left-hander
curling away from Powell as he lines it up and leaves it alone
on the off stump, lifting through to the keeper, more late away movement
climbing off the pitch, through to the keeper. Good carry but no stroke needed
tucked into the gap
good carry, but nothing threatening from back of a length
round the wicket, and blocked on off stump
fuller length, wide line, no stroke offered
big nibble! Cuts back from outside off, over the top of middle, for Bairstow to gather low down the leg side. Lively...
opens the face to dab a firm back-cut through third man. Broad pays for his back-of-a-length approach. So much time to wait and deflect that ball
fuller, but wide again. Left alone
drawn onto the front foot, pushed into the off side
poking forward to defend
movement from leg to off, Brathwaite closes the face to work the ball into the leg side
up on the toes, and tapped into the off side
worked off the hip out to backward square
up on the toes to defend
wide of off stump, more good carry but Powell is refusing to indulge his tactics
better ball, attacking the stumps, tapped through point to steal the single
drawn forward and punched through the covers.
curling past the edge
fuller length, tapped through midwicket
climbing off the seam, wobbles past a tentative prod. Another over notched up
late inswinger! That would have been plumb if Powell hadn't shaved his inside edge in the midst of a desperate crease-bound prod
outswinger on off stump, worked with the angle and they take on Moeen's arm in the covers... successfully
poked to the leg side
back of a length, tapped to the covers and more sharp running to keep England frustrated
lifting off the seam, Powell drops his hands, lets the ball arrive, and Stokes tidies up a low deflection into the gully
solidly into line to defend
better from Broad! A foot fuller, slightly too wide of off stump, but draws a tentative sliding-doors defence all the same
nips back into the pads, half an appeal but sliding down
drawn forward on off stump and nurdled round the corner
outside off, too wide again
nips back off the seam, but into the thigh pad
angled into the left-hander from round the wicket and cuts back in sharply. Tight leave
through to the keeper
climbs off the seam, but still not getting the batsmen to play enough
that's a good-looking delivery, jagging away from a tight line. Could it be a foot fuller though?
edged and gone! Anderson gets it right again, and this time there's no mistake as Brathwaite hangs his bat in the channel and Bairstow gathers the thin nick. 498 and counting!
outside off, nips through to the keeper
fuller length, looking for the late outswinger. Met with a full face, to complete a wicket maiden
round the wicket, dabbed to the off side
outside off again, lifting off the pitch
full length again, worked to the leg side
round the wicket, left alone outside off. There's been a lot of that this morning
better line, but still too short to draw a stroke as the ball angles in
attacking off this time, and duly blocked
full outside off, some gentle away movement, left alone
full, angled in at off stump, Hope (K) gets onto the front foot and defends
84mph, left alone outside off
that's a good one! Full at off stump, makes Hope play, then nips away late past the outside edge
back of a length at middle and off, defended
touch wider outside off, he shuffles across then leaves it alone
round the wicket, too straight and that's a strong flick off the legs through midwicket
short of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length, at off stump, pushed square into the off side...needs to get it fuller
this one is fuller, but outside off, some seam movement and Bairstow takes it in front of his face
that's a decent one, angled in from round the wicket, back of a length, beats the outside edge
straightens the line, Powell misses his flick and takes the pad to the leg side
full outside off, 82mph, left alone
gets across outside off stump and defends to the leg side

499 for Anderson! On that full length outside off, late away movement, Hope in two minds whether to play to leave and the ball takes takes the toe. Bairstow doesn't risk leaving this one for Cook, dives across and takes it very nicely
that's the shot of a confident batsman, gets forward into a full delivery and plays a very well controlled punched through the covers
this one comes back in, on a full length, defended to cover
short of a length, he's on control as he plays with soft hands and it takes the outside edge to ground then wide of fourth slip
too straight again, on the pads and flicked neatly through square leg
back outside off, full, left alone
pushed across very wide outside off, Bairstow gathers in front of first slip...not clicking for Broad
straightens the line, but is still a comfortable leave as it moves away outside off
fuller, at middle and off, clipped to mid-on
full at off stump, driven firmly to cover
pushed up at off stump, 83mph, Hope gets himself forward and plays to mid-on
wider, swings away, left alone
this one wobbles all over the place! It's wide outside off, nips back off the seam and then does a little swerve as it reaches Bairstow. Just clings on
a good 'un! Hope presses forward, gets beaten by one which straightens off a good length and bounces
angled back in at off stump, defended towards point
gets onto the pads, but doesn't cost him anything as this is flicked towards midwicket
over the wicket, short of a length outside off, driven from the back foot into point
short of a length at off stump, defended to mid-on
defended into the covers
wider outside off, just short of a length, through to Bairstow at waist height
nearly another edge from a leave alone, like his brother, but pulls the bat away at the last moment and avoids the ball
back of a length outside off, left alone...steady start
full outside off, left alone
touch wider, zips across the left hander...now will he look to bring one back?
edges it closer to off stump, Powell presses forward and leaves alone
on off stump, good length, solidly defended to the covers
starts outside off, full length, Powell able to watch it go through
just a little too wide, through to the keeper
short, wide, left alone
tries to adjust and pushes this one down the leg side
full, at the stumps, defended to mid-on
short of a length outside off, 81mph, defended towards backward point
short outside off, he drops his hands and lets it through
better length to finish with, but he's able to leave it alone again to end the session
inducker on the leg stump, strikes the pads
through to the keeper outside off
sharp swing from leg to off, stabbed round the corner
fizzing through, tight line, nibbling away from a vertical poke
angling back into the right-hander, defended on the back foot
very full, attacking the stumps, punched up to mid-off
round the wicket, full length but not a lot of carry past the off stump
attacking the stumps from round the wicket, blocked
punched into the off side, full face of the blade
pushed out to point
good delivery, pitches on off and straightens to take the edge. But there's very little carry and third slip gathers the edge on the bounce, and throws it in the air to get the crowd over-excited
forward and that's a sweet strike! Clean through mid-off, all timing, minimum of power
a yawning leave-alone, through to the keeper
forward and punched through point. Another good connection to keep the runs flowing
curling back into the pads, defended
that is beautiful! Hope is starting to tick now, foot right to the pitch of the ball and a sweet punch along the ground through the covers
absolute jaffa! That rips like a legbreak from a middle and leg line, bursting past the edge and into Bairstow's gloves! Play that if you can!
banged in short, no stroke this time as it holds its line past the edge. Getting closer...
outside off, round the wicket, no stroke offered. The usual fare
onto the front foot to push into the off side
straightens on an off-stump line, but fractionally back of a length. Lined up and defended with plenty of time to adjust. Just 79mph on that occasion
outside off, through to the keeper
over the wicket this time, attacking the base of off stump and driven slightly uncomfortably off an inside-edge to midwicket
curling away from the left-hander, a hint of swing in evidence but nothing alarming
jagging back in down the slope, clipped leg-side
too wide of off stump, and chopped down the hill, using the width and the slope to pick off a freebie four
wide again, but a fuller length. Left alone
left alone, wide line again
tighter to off stump, fuller length, dead-batted back down the pitch
that's better, climbs on off stump and punches past the edge. Powell tries his utmost not to be lured into a stroke
stabbed defence, striding onto the front foot and pushed to cover with head and front pad thrust forward
much fuller, wide of off stump and swinging away. Ignored, but only after a brief flirtation with a wild slashing drive
through to the keeper on a fourth-stump line
dies on impact, Bairstow takes with a tumble
tighter line, targeting the stumps and squeezed to safety from deep in the crease
Broad's getting closer, but can't find the edge as Hope plays inside the line once more
a swing and a miss! Powell is, for once, drawn into a rash drive, beaten by the angle across his bows as TRJ tempts him with the full length
well bowled again, another awkward stab outside off as the ball nibbles through to the keeper
nudged off the hip, into the leg side
driven on the up to mid-on
on the pads, worked to square leg
worked square once more. Tightening the line to cramp the left-hander
forward and pushed back to the bowler
on the legs and whisked behind square with a fine connection. More runs to the impressive Hope
nipping back and a big appeal! Broad is interested but it did look high to the naked eye, and Root declines the review. Yep, a good six inches too high
onto the front foot, firmly struck back to the bowler, and a fierce shy as well. No real need for it, but I'm sure Broad feels better
wide line, swinging away, it's not really happening for Broad just yet
on the back foot, defended into the off side
very full, and oddly slow from TRJ, swinging in under the batsman's nose and punched firmly down to a chasing long-on
hops onto the back foot to defend
good nip this time, jags up the slope and past the edge. Wel bowled. That's the line that's got him Test recognition
that, on the other hand, is not. On the pads, and clipped firmly down the slope to the Tavern rope
fuller length, wider line, no stroke offered
outside off and through to the keeper once more
angled defence, definite hint of swing, but takes a low edge through the cordon. Interesting start...
more clear signs of swing but starting on the leg stump and drifting in late to off. Clipped hard to deep midwicket
angled defence, picking the swing and deflecting it down into the gully
outside off, left alone as it swings past the stumps. Useful movement from Stokes, if he can harness it
very full again, swinging late towards the cordon, flicked on the up to midwicket
a decent first over
keeping it tight to off stump, left alone with an upraised bat
outside off, no stroke once again
inside-out drive, not entirely convincing, but an effective enough connection on the up and through midwicket
through to the keeper, a bit more dart off the seam. Well bowled
gosh, that one really leapt from a good length! Not quite David Saker proportions, but along those lines! Outside off, fortunately, and left alone
through to the keeper again, a bit of a nibble as it goes by
nip off the seam, and Powell is half-suckered by this one, down the slope and through to the keeper
driven hard, back down the pitch where Stokes swoops well in his followthrough to gather
left alone, no stroke offered
round the wicket, straightening off a good length and through to the keeper
wide of off stump, very full length
short and sharp, Powell has a swish off his eyebrows and doesn't connect. Probably just as well, as he wasn't in control of that stroke
good lift off the pitch, defended into the off side
banged in short, on the back foot, pushed to the off side
dabbed into the off side
that's a cracking drive! Just a tiny bit over-pitched, and Hope leans into a sumptuous drive, clean through the covers
nice take down the leg side by Bairstow, swooping with one hand as TRJ strays onto the hip

Cook has only gone and caught one! And he is delighted, as Roland-Jones bangs one into the splice of Hope's still-vertical bat, for a thin deflection to bobble through to first slip! Was it straight in ... hmm... more or less, but those weren't the liquid mitts of old! A timely strike, as Hope was beginning to purr...
outside off, left alone
curling from back of a length, through to the keeper
in the channel outside off, straightening off the deck and through to the keeper

drilled straight back to Stokes, who bends at the knee and scoops a fine catch in both hands! Powell's resistance ends at precisely the wrong moment for West Indies, who now have two players yet to face a ball ...
outside off, swinging back in from a wide line. No stroke
through to the keeper once more
very full and TRJ is almost up for a raucous lbw shout, but reckons that that grazed the bat first. I think he's right, and the umpire agrees as the ball flies through fine leg
very full again, leg-sided, and clipped very firmly on the up through square leg
through to the keeper, and left alone
full and straight, pushed back down the pitch
wide outside off, no stroke needed this time
tapped into the covers to get off the mark
yeehar, careful now! Wide of off stump and a wild hard-handed drive at nothing. Stokes looks askance in his followthrough
wider line, more circumspect this time
big leave outside off stump
left alone, good discipline from batsman and bowler. A game of cat and mouse developing after that rash shot earlier in the over
well bowled, tighter line, fuller length, squeezed to safety on the back foot
drops the hands to defend to the off side
wild and woolly, and over goes the timbers! Rash from Blackwood, but was ever thus. Full, straight, tempting the slog across the line, and missing by a mile!
on off stump, good length, defended to midwicket
full, wide outside off, some late swing as it's left alone
back of a length at off stump, 82mph, defended towards short leg
fuller, brings him forward, he drives and the bat face closes a touch which means he finds mid-on
full outside off, a late decision to leave alone
there's an ask about a catch down the leg side, Chase shuffled across at a short-of-a-length ball angled into his pads but only Bairstow showed much interest
on the popping crease outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, tries to withdraw the bat and it comes off the face towards fourth slip, but into the ground well short
strangled appeal, Chase falling across a full ball but angling down the leg side...might have hit it, too
good length at off stump, defended
full outside off, left alone
good length outside off, defended and it takes the splice
plays a forcing shot off the back foot to a short-of-a-length ball outside off, takes the bottom edge and scuttles towards the slips
left alone outside off
full at off stump, he's across the crease and defends to cover
goes for the yorker, dug out to the off side
onto the front foot and pushes a full delivery to mid-on
punched straight back down the pitch, Stokes gets it in his follow through
short of a length, gets inside the line and knocks it down just in front of Stoneman at short leg
shoved down the leg side
very wide outside off, some late swing but easy to leave
big inswinger, started just a fraction too straight and zips into the pads
good length outside off, Chase is reaching away from his body a little but defends safely to point
left alone outside off
defended to mid-on
keeps it full at off stump, takes the bottom of the bat as he drives
short ball on leg stump, Chase swivels on a pull and gets it fine of long leg who is very square
short of a length outside off, swings late as it reaches Bairstow who tumbles to gather it
full outside off, left alone
that's a poor shot with the ball moving, reaching a long way away from his body at a full delivery
learns from his mistake, leaves alone outside off
big movement! This comes back a long way, jags in at Dowrich off the seam, beats the inside edge and takes him high on the pads
more inswing, this started too straight and goes down the leg side
well bowled, gets back on off stump, just back of a length, squares up Dowrich and it finds the outside edge but falls short of second slip...ah, a very late call of no-ball
ends with another booming in-ducker which he pushes down the leg side and gives Bairstow more work
edged! But wide of slip. Tossed it up wide outside off, Chase chased it with the drive and there was no chance for Stokes
straighter, at off stump, defended to cover
that's a big full toss, we see a few of them from Moeen, driven to deep cover
plays back and defends to the on side
back and across, pushes to the bowler
a fraction short, defended on the back foot to cover
full outside off, started wider and it swings back at Dowrich who pushes off the front foot into the covers...off the mark from his 18th ball
what a ball! That's unplayable. A leg-break at 85mph. Angles in at off stump, pitches, straightens off the seam to beat the edge and clip off stump. Chase ends up square on facing down the pitch
full and straight, pushed into the covers

has this carried? Yes, Dowrich is off! Good length outside off, more outswing, he has a nibble and Cook grabs it very low. Now, though, Dowrich has stopped. Going to check it's carried. It goes straight in, neat take from Cook after his recent problems
full outside off, left alone
very full, swings back, left alone
full outside off, he presses forward and pushes into the point area
round the wicket, on off stump, defended
pushed to mid-off
worked into the leg side
very full, a yorker, defended to the off side and Bairstow appeals thinking it's pad first but think it came right off the face
speared into the pads, heading down the leg side
pushed down the leg side
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
another good one, back of a length outside off and climbs past the outside edge
nearly has a nibble at this one outside off, may have just pulled the bat inside the line
pushes this fuller, Holder playing away from his body with a rather half-hearted drive and is beaten by the late swing
big inswinger, heading down the leg side
edged, but just wide of Stokes at slip, aiming to play square off the back foot, takes the top edge and evades Stokes' left hand
full at off stump, defended
pushed forward into the covers
full at middle and leg, defended down the pitch
strides forward and blocks to the covers
slides on with the arm, defended on the back foot
good length outside off, coming in with the angle then straightening off the seam, left alone
beats the edge this time, a fraction fuller and straighter, Holder felt he had to play
fuller, wider too though, left alone
a short delivery outside off, he nearly has a flirt at it as the ball rises through to Bairstow
out with a hit! A fuller ball, pushed into the covers, was hestitation from both batsmen and Bishoo would have been short if TRJ had it from cover
round the wicket, full and straight, jabbed to mid-on
works a straight ball to midwicket
pushed back to the bowler
drives at a wider delivery, gets it behind point and the sweeper can't stop the second
plays over the top of a full delivery, bounces off Bairstow's pads
has a big mow at this one, delivery goes on straight and beats the outside edge
flatter, quicker, outside off and left alone
round the wicket, full outside off, left alone
pushed down the leg side
full at off stump, defended to the covers...he's overstepped
gets some fortune here, driving a full delivery and the inside edge scoots past leg stump
nips back off a good length, beats the inside edge and takes the pads, going down
back over the wicket, Bishoo pushes at a full delivery and is beaten
left alone outside off
full, wide outside off, dies on its way through to Bairstow
nearly finds the edge, a lovely outswinger on a good length which Holder plays forward at
slightly shorter, more seam movement and it beats the outside edge again...anticipation in the crowd (and from the slip cordon)
fuller, he plays forward and another skims past the bat
slightly straighter, on the stumps, defended to midwicket
this one finds the edge, good length outside off, but played with soft enough hands that it's short of fourth slip. Classy over
full, wide outside off, left alone
nearly through him with the off-stump yorker! Moves late to beat the bat and the off stump
wider, through to the keeper
dragged down wider outside off, no threat in this one
full at off stump, pushed off the front foot into the gap at cover
this comes back sharply from outside off, in the air then a little more off the seam, Holder gets his bat down on it...a little chat between Stokes and Holder
full at off stump, defended to cover
starts too wide, moves away further, left alone
pushed very wide again, through to the keeper...500 on his mind?
changes to round the wicket and it nearly works, a back-of-a-length delivery straightens to beat the outside edge
and it's too wide outside off, left alone
gets it closer to off stump, beats the outside edge by a long way as Bishoo plays forward
defended into the off side, thought of a single but was rightly sent back
dropped! By Joe Root at second slip. Brings him forward, finds the outside edge, Root dives to his left and can't hang on
and this one is driven in the air but behind point...is that smoke coming out of Stokes' ears?
beats him this time, full outside off, what a spell this has been from Stokes
he may have just held his bat inside the line of this length delivery outside off
short of a length, angled down the leg side
outside off, swinging away, no stroke offered
left alone outside off stump, lots of swing, but almost too much as Bishoo isn't lured
wide line, no stroke again
tidy. Angling in from round the wicket, nipping away
ripper. Really exploding through to Bairstow's gloves, hitting the seam, climbing sharply and straightening. Can't play that
fuller and wider. Left alone
round the wicket, defended into the leg side
left alone outside off stump
good shape on a wide line, Holder stretches forward but leaves alone

that is stunning! Massive inswing from Stokes, a Jimmy-esque change-up as the ball bursts through Holder's startled and flimsy defences, curling like a sun-bathing python into the base of middle stump!
takes the edge as it climbs from a full length. Fenced into the cordon
more inswing, but left alone outside off this time
outside edge, down through the cordon, and there is Bishoo's 500 Test runs! What utter scenes... of massive indifference as the ball dribbles over the rope
huge inducker to the left-hander, and Bishoo had no idea about this as he let it fizz over his stumps! So close!
beaten by the one that swings away! Jimmy is pulling out his full repertoire of tricks here...
good grief, how did that miss? Miss the edge, of bat, of off stump ... that was unplayable on every level. Even the umpire winced at that one!
another snorter curls over the top of off, as Ottis Gibson and Trevor Bayliss chuckle on the balcony
beaten again! 'Wasted on thee, lad,' as Fred Trueman would have said. Shape, pace, dip, nip, swing, and nibble all on show. And areas. Don't forget areas
outside off, through to the keeper
edged and gone, Anderson of all people dives like a rampant salmon from fourth slip in front of third, and Stokes has his fifth!
humungous inswing, the stumps are splattered, and Stokes has stolen the King of Swing's thunder!
leg-sided to launch the innings
outside off, and through to the keeper
good pace, full length, left alone. Umpire Erasmus has a look at his followthrough, which may be encroaching a touch on the danger zone
fully forward and blocked into the covers
wide of off stump
targeting off stump, very tight into the umpire. Blocked firmly back whence it came
back of a length, on the hip, tucked to the leg side
nipping off the seam and through to the keeper, late movement keeps first slip in the firing line as the ball swings by
solidly into line
through to the keeper, swinging past an upturned bat
well bowled! Nips past the edge from just  back of a length, Cook flinches as it goes by
left alone once again
very tight to off stump, needs good judgement to let that go by
climbing off the seam, no stroke again

edged and gone! Stoneman's resolve outside off crumbles as Roach tempts him on a tight line with extra lift, and Dowrich sidles across to swallow the nick! That's a very untimely failure for a batsman who had just threatened to prove himself at Headingley
big inducker to greet Westley! Climbs into the back leg and spangs him hard on the inner thighpad. Buckle up!
fully forward this time, smothering all incomers with a full face
outside off, swinging away
through to the keeper once more
on the pads, and tucked to the leg side
massive appeal and West Indies go up as one! But that looks to the naked eye to have beaten the bat and flicked his back leg. What a ball though, taking off up the slope at 92mph!
this one dips into the right-hander as Westley waits on the back foot to defend
through to the keeper once again on a tight, edge-grazing line. Westley survives
through to the keeper once again, probing line
swing from the hand, wider of off stump and through to the keeper
pokey defence, angled bat, a stolen four through third man. He does hoover them up down there
wide of off stump, nipping away, Cook lines it up and lets it go
well bowled again, jagging away from the left-hander on a full length. Cook compactly deflects it into the covers
stabbed into the leg side, another welcome single, as five slips lurk for the indiscretion
lifting through to the keeper
good leave, playing the angle across the stumps. 92mph, that one, so not a lot of time to make his mind up
forward, poked to cover
full length, dug out from deep in the crease
leaning into a forward defensive push to cover
on the pads, flicked to the leg side
back of a length, fierce lift and defended on the back foot
fuller this time to follow up, good aggressive intent as Westley does his best not to play at it, and doesn't quite succeed
an angled drive into the leg side, that's the shot that's got him into bother this series, but it gets him off the mark today
outside off, nipping away, Cook follows it and briefly chastises himself
lifting through to the keeper
forward once more to defend
on the hip and flicked fine
defended on the back foot, good aggression
well bowled once more, ghosting past the outside edge as Westley plays for a line that is no longer there
wider line, back of a length, left alone
another good line, angling into the right hander. Westley has to bide his time
another beauty climbs at pace past the edge. No disgrace in being beaten by that. There's nothing to hit out there at the moment
back of a length, Cook instantly assesses Holder's lesser pace and climbs into an exploratory pull, to short midwicket
outside off, and boshed through the covers off the back foot
round the wicket, and through to the keeper
round the wicket, defended to cover
in the channel once more
forward and defended back down the pitch
climbing through to the keeper, good carry but easily left alone
fuller length, and Westley kneels into a compact drive to cover point
stretching forward, blocked to the covers
a half-hearted appeal for a run-out as Cook slides his bat in for a quick single. Never in doubt. On we go
open-faced stab out to the covers
pushed firmly out to deep extra cover
up on the toes, pushed out to cover
sliding down the leg side
plugging away on an off-stump line, blocked
through to the keeper once again
onto the front foot, driven hard to cover
through to the keeper, no stroke offered
short of a length, nips back off the seam, takes an inside edge into the pads
fuller, outside off, left alone
good area, fullish outside off, Cook slightly in two minds and the ball hits the face without him in complete control
short, wide outside off, left alone
on off stump, defended to the covers
that's a lovely delivery, edged behind! Angled in at off stump, nips off the seam, grazes the outside edge. They've worked hard for that
full outside off, left alone
touch fuller, he gets forward and drives to mid-off
that's a lovely shot, gets a fraction too straight and Westley clips it strongly through midwicket
back outside off, short of a length, he pulls the bat inside the line
full and straight, defended back to the bowler who throws and the stumps and hits them

and another! On off stump, beats the outside edge and he's not reviewing. Short of a good length, it's umpire's call on impact and hitting so good call not to ask. Enough seam movement to square him up a touch, excellent bowling
back of a length outside off, pushed and run into the covers...Root will look to be proactive
full at off stump, defended to the leg side
full outside off, Malan drives it straight of a diving mid-off and it has the legs to reach the rope
drags the length back but also gets a touch too wide, left alone
more significant seam movement, from short of a length just outside off, beats Malan's edge by a long way
and he's done him again with an off-cutter to the left hander, nips away sharply off the seam from a good length

what a moment! Root goes, Powell clings on at firsts slip. Short of a length outside off, Root forcing off the back foot, Dowrich starts to move but, unlike at Headingley, doesn't fully dive and Powell holds his nerve. Not one of Root's best shots given the circumstances
full at off stump, defended
gets across the crease and tucks a straight delivery to long leg
this nips back from short of a length, Malan defends somewhat hurriedly
fuller at off stump, defended
short and wide, left alone
full, swings away, left alone - was round the wicket
makes a late decision to leave this full delivery and it runs off the face to the slips
finds the edge, but it scoots wide of fourth slip...full from round the wicket, at off stump, Stokes pushing forward but gets the ball to ground quickly
very full, he latches on and drives wide of mid-off
onto the front foot again and drives, finds mid-off this time
that's a beauty! Turns Stokes around with a delivery on off stump
wide outside off, left alone
he's nicely in control of this one, back of a length outside off, opens the face and steers it behind point
this is loose, however, as he wafts over the top of this deliveru
full outside off, comes in with the angle from round the wicket but is wide enough to leave
short of a length outside off, punched through point off the back foot and a knock-on by the chasing fielder allows a third
over the wicket, and the change nearly works! A ripping off cutter which zips past Stokes' outside edge
short of a length, carries on the rise to Dowrich who is rushed in his gather
fuller, late movement away, Malan holds the original line
off-stump yorker, dug out to the bowler
across onto off stump and tucks a full delivery through midwicket
he has to quick here! Defends a full delivery and it spins back towards the stumps, heads very close to off stump and he has to knock it away to be safe
finds the outside edge as he pushes away from his body and it falls short of third slip
starts to walk at the bowler and then leaves alone a length delivery
back of a length, pushed straight
tight to off stump from over the wicket, left alone
full and straight, clipped off the stumps through midwicket
back outside off, defended on the front foot
back of a length outside off, left alone
full, wide outside off, left alone
full at off stump, Malan squirts a drive off the outer part of the bat through point
short of a length on leg stump, takes the thigh pad
full and straight, clipped towards mid-on
drags the length back, outside off, barely reaches Dowrich
that's a strong shot, gets forward to a full delivery outside off and drives handsomely wide of mid-off
round the wicket, good length outside off, left alone and Dowrich can't gather cleanly...maybe some wobble
shorter and wider, left alone
straighter, back of a length, worked to mid-on
short and wide, Stokes throws his hands through a cut shot and it flies behind point
straightens the line, short of a length at off stump, Stokes across the crease and tucks into midwicket
good length outside off, gets well forward and pushes firmly to cover for a tight(ish) single
good length at middle, 89mph, defended
angled across outside off, seams away further, left alone
back of a length at middle, takes a thick inside edge through square leg
an appeal for lbw, but this was quite short so surely pitched outside leg and looked high as well. Well outside leg
on leg stump, clipped off the pads down to long leg
nicely played, more timing than power, gets well forward and drives it straight of mid-off who is quite wide
stays round the wicket, full and wide outside off, left alone and another that Dowrich doesn't glove as he dives across in front of first slip
full outside off, Malan well across his crease and defends
wide outside off, left alone
edged and gone! Roach the man from round the wicket. Just outside off, back of a length, Malan has to play, nips off the seam and carries low to Dowrich who takes the one that matters
gets a bouncer first up, from wide on the crease, angles back and Bairstow sways out of the line
on the stumps, defended to the off side
round the wicket, not far from dragging on, playing forward at a full ball and takes the inside edge through square leg
short of a length outside off, left alone
angling into the pads, punched confidently into space on the leg side

edged and dropped! A fizzing delivery, bursts off the pitch, into the splice and high and hard to Kyle Hope's left at second slip! In the end, to be fair, he did well to save runs. But Holder had just moved his third slip away one ball earlier... he's back now...
a fraction over-pitched, and Stokes drills a punchy on-drive straight back past the bowler. That'll smart...
in the channel outside off, but Gabriel has over-stepped
pushed into the on-side. So nearly a perfect resumption for West Indies
onto the front foot, pushed into the covers
oh well bowled. Wider on the crease, angling the ball in towards the off stump, down the slope and tight past a flinching edge
a carbon copy! Swings late after it passes the bat too, lovely shape, perfect area. Bairstow survives
sliding down, as Bairstow strides a long way across his stumps. Deflected fine as his head falls away to the off side
good delivery again, fuller length, on a wide line and dug out on the crease
outside off, ghosts away late. This is good probing bowling from West Indies, letting the conditions do the hard work
swishing away down the leg side, and a very good leaping stop from Dowrich to intercept four certain byes
round the wicket, flicked with the angle down to fine leg, who gathers on the bounce in one fluid movement
nips back off the seam, down the slope, inside the edge of a loose poke
pushed into the off side, dancing at the crease
whipped off the pads, down the slope towards deep square leg
pushed into space at mid-on
that's a tremendous strike, not a terrible delivery but just enough width to free the arms. And out they come, with a bottom-handed bunt through the covers. Timed to perfection
pushed hard on the back foot to cover
punched into the off side, still from round the wicket
lets this one go by on a good length outside off
banged in short, an ambitious swing across the line, and the ball takes off well clear of the top of his blade
a well-judged leave to finish, a strong awareness of the whereabouts of his off stump
speared into the right-hander from wide on the crease, Bairstow stands tall to whip a defensive push to mid-on
confidently driven, into the covers
short and climbing through to the keeper
on the pads, clipped with sweet timing down to the Mound Stand rope. A productive area since the resumption
on the back foot, fenced back down the pitch with a touch of late adjustment to ride the bounce
more front-foot issues for Gabriel as Bairstow defends on his back foot
flicked uppishly to the sweeper at deep midwicket
well wide of off stump, a bit of a sighter, and Stokes does well to reach it with a toe-ended pull
that's a crushing pull! But straight to the deep midwicket sweeper. He didn't have time to move, so was perfectly positioned to cut off the boundary
outside off, keeps a touch low. Through to the keeper
chopped into the off side
back of a length, whipped to the leg side
not quite there for the drive, but Bairstow has a go anyway, toe-ending a loose steer into the covers. A touch of swing in that delivery too
fully forward, punched to cover
clipped back down the pitch, half-stopped in the bowler's followthrough
outside off, and dabbed into the covers
a loose drive from Bairstow. Outside off and climbing past a wild slash
into line to defend
a swing and a miss! Drifting away at the last second, as Bairstow aims another hard-handed drive in the direction of Maida Vale
panned through midwicket! A short-arm pull, picking the length with ease and cashing in on the fractionally wider line
forward and defended
round the wicket, fenced into the leg side
short, and pulled through midwicket. That's a more confident blow from Bairstow, back of a length and crunched through the gap
well bowled, a good yorker, zeroing in on leg stump and just about dug out
onto the front foot, punched to cover
wide outside off stump, no stroke
another judicious leave-alone
edged, but always safe. A wide ball from Roach, Stokes chases it and snicks low past gully
thumped with purpose to deep cover
a toe-ended cut, down into the gully
firmly driven to mid-off
left alone outside off

wow, that is some timing! Nothing more than a defensive push through mid-on, but the first sign that he'd nailed it was his urgent call for a single as it raced through the gap. In the end, it kept racing all the way to the rope!
width, cut, fifty. Easy pickings for a player in quite some form at the moment
tight defence on off stump, head right over the ball
pushed into the gap at mid-off
shoulders arms to complete the over
wide outside off, no stroke offered
chopped into the off side
left alone again
big nip off the seam from an off stump line. But confidently left
on the pads, whipped to the leg side
a nibble outside off stump! Loose from Bairstow, who hasn't entirely settled in spite of his confidence off the pads
outside off, no stroke offered
pushed to the off side
high-elbowed defence, a quick single to mid-off
angled defence into the covers
drilled, but straight at the fielder
beaten again, that's a fine delivery, angling in, shaping away, and passing the edge
crashing drive into the covers, well stopped
punched into the off side
firmly tonked into the acres of empty space in the covers
wide line, nipping back in sharply, punched hard off the back foot in a defensive gesture
that's another snorter! Genuine pace and exploding off a good length, Bairstow came forward to meet it then beat a hasty retreat as the ball took off past him
bosh! Bairstow's most confident shot of the day, though it looked to be entirely powered by adrenalin. A bent-knee crunch through the covers

big appeal, and given out lbw! Bairstow calls for a review, as well he might, it nipped back sharply and took off as the batsman retreated into his crease. But nope, that is crashing into leg stump. Roach has earned that!
low full toss, seeking the yorker but a touch over-pitched. A well-timed clip to midwicket but an even better stop. West Indies are On It Like A Bonnet
outside off, swinging away, left alone
onto the front foot, pushed back to the bowler
back and across to defend as Stokes gets right behind the line
down on one knee, crunched to deep cover
forward, clipped firmly back past the bowler, who half-stops in his followthrough
a flowing drive out to deep cover, the sweeper has been well positioned in this innings
banged in short, Moeen ducks
defended once more
up on the toes, dabbed into the leg side
parried into the cordon, a bit of a flinching poke, bat away from the body
wide of off stump, no stroke this time
round the wicket, angled in, left alone
drilled on the up, to mid-on
a curious leading edge through the covers. They all count
bowled him! That is a huge moment, round the wicket, a hint of inswing, and despite an immaculate forward defensive ... oh hang on ... he's over-stepped!
round the wicket again, drifting in, and worked into the leg side
wow! He's bowled an absolute carbon copy replica! Stokes once again stretches forward to defend, but the angle, the length, and the late inswing makes for an unplayable combination!
slips onto the pads, nicely clipped but straight into short leg
aggressively, by the looks of it, as he drives at a wide delivery that moves further
full outside off, extravagant movement away after it pitches
touch closer to off stump, left alone
that's a good one, a shorter delivery, draws Moeen into having a poke and it seams past the edge
opens the face at a short-of-a-length delivery and dabs into the backward point area
full outside off, TRJ pushes forward and gets beaten
length ball angled in from round the wicket, Moeen aims to the leg side and gets a leading edge to cover
gets forward and swishes through a drive without making contact...slips, stay ready
more in control this time, driven to mid-off
a shorter delivery, at off stump, defended
goes after the short ball this time with a good pull shot, well in front of square
defended at the top of the bounce
full outside off, left alone
short of a length, defended
grabbed in the gully! Roach has five. Keeps it full outside off, Moeen can't resist going after it, drives on the up, and it's a sharp catch by Kyle Hope
that's a sharp short ball! Skims over Broad's head as he barely has time to move, wasn't expecting that
and another! Angled towards leg stump, think he knew that one was coming
short of a length at off stump, Broad jumps and defends the ball down by his feet
flicked off his pads to deep square leg
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, defended
angled into the pads, glances fine of the diving keeper to long leg
short at leg stump, a confident hook to long leg
full, angled in at off stump, pushed through the vacant mid-on area
pushes at a length delivery and it takes the inside edge into midwicket
gets forward into a length delivery and squeezes it off the inside edge wide of short leg
what a beauty, full outside off from round the wicket and nips away to beat the edge
full at middle and leg, turned to short leg
a bouncer, he ducks underneath
beats the outside edge with a short delivery which seams away
a strangled appeal for lbw as this takes the pad, a very full delivery which is heading leg side
a bouncer over off stump, he sways out of the line
short of a length outside off, he crunches a pull but straight to mid-on
full outside off, driven to cover
again he pulls the short ball, finds deep square leg and it's another no-ball as well
ends up getting this through cover, moved onto leg stump, exposes all his stumps, then drives the full delivery
this time he tries to swing a short ball from well wide outside off over the leg side but only finds fresh air...not sure he heard the call of no-ball from the umpire (was a big one from the crowd)
now he's over the wicket, beats him with a full delivery outside off, not far from off stump
full and straight, pushed to point
gives himself a touch of room outside leg again, swings through the line of a full delivery and sends it wide of mid-off
good length at off stump, defended to cover
back of a length, played towards mid-on
that's a beauty, angled in from wide on the crease, pitches around off stump then straightens to beat the edge
excellent shot, short and a fraction wide outside off, Roland-Jones cuts it behind point
dropped! That's a horror one from Dowrich, through his gloves. Roland-Jones flashing at a short-of-a-length delivery, a simple chance almost straight to him. Oh dear
back of a length, played back to the bowler
over the wicket, angled across, plays inside the line
opens himself up again, tries to drive on the up and misses...Dowrich doesn't glove it cleanly
no run, banged in short, Broad moving to the leg side then defends
short ball outside leg stump, swung away backward of square, bisects deep square and long leg
that's a heave, swinging across the line of a length delivery, gets a bottom edge to deep square
edged! But just short of the slips. Good length, makes Roland-Jones plays, his hands are soft enough to get the ball to ground
round the wicket, full outside off, bobbles to mid-on
that's a wild mow, gives himself room and isn't actually anywhere near the ball
good ball, full at off stump, seams away and is beaten
full at off stump, pushed to cover who is quite deep
short of a length, zips over the top edge as Broad aims through the off side
swing...miss, ball was wide outside off, Broad staying leg side. A lot of fresh air in that maiden
full outside off, swings away, left alone
short of a length, pushed off the back foot to cover
flashes, and caught at gully! Full, wide outside off, Roland-Jones chases it with a drive and the thick edge is snaffled at waist height
round the wicket, short of a length, a leading edge to the covers and a loud cheer as Anderson gets off the mark
a leg-stump yorker, dug out as he shuffles outside leg stump
over the wicket, length ball at off stump, heaved to mid-on and in the end they get a single as a needless throw from Holder is hurled towards mid-on
backs away, then upper-cuts a short delivery just over backward point...actually, was more of a straight bat than a cross-bat shot
another wild swing and a miss to a ball outside off
full and straight, he just about stays in line and drives to mid-off
carved over the off side, moving to the leg side again, not sure he was even looking at the ball, skews high over backward point
exposes all his stumps, thrashes at a length delivery, through to the keeper
high and handsome! That's a sweet strike...opens his shoulders against a fuller delivery, sends it well over cover into the crowd
oh, Jimmy! (or the Burnley Lara). Length ball outside off from round the wicket, Anderson drives on the up through the covers
straightens the line, gets across and tucks it into square leg
over the wicket, full outside off, driven to mid-off

strikes through the line of a length delivery, goes miles in the air, clears mid-off, then plugs in the outfield...Gabriel hadn't even started chasing it, and Broad was barely running to start with. Good cricket
seams away outside off, Dowrich dives across in front of first slip
fuller at off stump, defended and it runs off the face to point
into the crowd again! Broad making merry. Short of a length outside off, gives him room to swing his arms, flies high over backward point
that's a sharp bouncer, Broad fends it off the body behind square...Dowrich chases it then slips. What a day for him!
round the wicket, length ball, prodded to point
now Anderson on the charge, comes down the pitch and crunches this to mid-off
short of a length outside off, a rather late prod at this and it runs to deep point
moves well outside leg to a full delivery speared into the pads, deflects towards gully
short, angled across outside off, goes over the top edge as Anderson tries to cut
that's a good one, comes back off the seam on a good length to beat the inside edge
a shortish delivery at leg stump, he's neatly inside the line and tucks it off his hip
a slower ball, wide outside off, Broad spots it late and is through his shot
and that's it...a bottom edge from Broad as he aims another swing to the leg side, against a short delivery, and it just about reaches Dowrich
outside off, tight line but keeps low through to the keeper
dangled outside off stump, nothing alarming on offer so far
a bit of extra bounce as it kicks through to the keeper on a tight line
forward, and the solid feel of bat on ball as Brathwaite presses cautiously to cover
into line again and defended
tapped into the covers, meeting the rising ball outside off stump
round the wicket to launch Broad's spell, in the channel outside off
met on the back foot with a dead-batted prod. Nothing spiteful in that delivery, plenty time to greet it with a straight bat
forward and nudged to the leg side, Broad back over the wicket to the right-hander
on the pads, and pleasingly chiselled through the leg side. Well timed
full and straight, defended back up the pitch
half an appeal, that's better from Broad! Tighter line, extra lift, and clips the back leg
good line and length, rising off the seam and through to the keeper
outside off, jabbed into the covers for a quick single
worked into the leg side with a flick of the bat
through to the keeper, curling away from the left hander from a tight line. That was closer to the off stump than Powell bargained for!
solid poke into the covers, up on the toes and good quick calling

bowled him for his 500th wicket! What a way to get there! A big inswinger, the first he's served up in the innings, demolishing the base of middle stump as Brathwaite plays all round it! A standing ovation for England's greatest wicket-taker, and a Kodak moment to cherish as well!
through to the keeper outside off stump
banged in short, climbing through to the keeper, no stroke offered
edged and dropped! Stokes of all people at fourth slip! It's missed his hands and hit him in the chest ... he simply didn't sight that one...
banged in short, outside off, Powell resists the nibble
slashed high and hard over third slip! Crikey, this match is in fast-forward. No hope of Root reaching that
wider on the crease from round the wicket, zinging through to the keeper
through to the keeper, tight line again
tapped into the off side, a bit of shy for an attempted run-out. Nothing doing
climbing off the seam, and nipping back between bat and body. Well bowled again
loose. Wider line, climbing through to the keeper and pursued by a wafty slash of willow
more good nip off the seam, climbing clear of the splice
well left, tight line, full length
through to the keeper with good carry, no stroke offered
dabbed off the back foot to mid-on
keeps low as it nips back into the stumps
through to the keeper once more, Broad starting to feel his way into a spell
a loose drive, but a good ball! Ghosts away from a hard-handed punch, angled in, shaping away
defended to the leg-side
a bit of wobble as Powell leaves alone, tight to off stump
on the pads, tucked to midwicket
round the wicket, jagging back into the left-hander from a full length
lifting off the deck, through to the keeper
angled bat, guided into the gully
good line, fractionally back of a length, straightens sharply after curling in to beat the edge
round the wicket, lifting off the deck, and left well alone
leg-sided, and Powell doesn't miss those. Firmly whipped through midwicket
on the pads, and tucked to the leg side
full length from over the wicket, driven with a good stride to mid-on
tapped into the covers off the front foot
full length, defended back to the bowler. Full from Broad is the way to go.
worked into the leg side
back outside off stump, climbing through to the keeper
too leg-sided, Jimmy looking for the magic ball but straying onto the toes from round the wicket
nipping off the seam and through to the keeper
another fine lifter outside off, bursting past Powell's edge with late nibble
tapped into the off side and an instant call. Running will be a vital aspect of West Indies' fightback
open faced punch out to point
nudged out to the leg side, slightly closed face on impact
good leave, Powell is judging it well outside off
worked into the leg side

Broad knows! That's plumb lbw, he doesn't even turn to look as he begins his celebrations... but Hope has reviewed.. was there an inside-edge? Nope, not a sausage! West Indies lose their second! That one tailed in from an already tight line, beat the edge and would have smashed middle and leg.
on the legs, clipped to the leg side
a short, wide loosener, and a toe-ended tonk through the cordon!
blocked to the off side
banged into the deck, and nipping back into the batsman
fuller length, and chiselled into the leg side
nip off the seam, and climbing past the edge. Well bowled again
solid block
tip and run into the off side
through to the keeper again
banged in short, a controlled pull round the corner to backward square
wide of off stump, climbing through to the keeper
on the back foot, tapped to the off side
defensive back-foot push to cover
angled in, and takes the splice, but drops short of the cordon! Good soft hands saved him there...
keeps low, through to the keeper
tidy line and length, waiting for the conditions to do his bidding
on the pads this time, worked to square leg
well bowled, a bouncing bomb of a delivery outside off, climbing sharply past an upraised bat
punched off the back foot into the off side. The hat trick will have to wait another day (or three balls)
outside off, through to the keeper
pushed to the off side
through to the keeper, that looked like a cross-seam delivery to mix it up
straining for the outswinger, defended on leg stump
full length, and that's neatly punched back past Stokes and all the way through mid-off. This is becoming another very well compiled innings from the put-upon Powell.
blotted into the off side
tidy line and length
on the back foot, rising with the lifting delivery to defend to the off side
defended on the back foot once again
outside off, through to the keeper again
on the back foot, attacking the stumps, defended to the leg side to complete the maiden over
on the legs, worked into the gap
round the wicket, very full length, calmly driven to mid-off
on the legs, threatening to straighten. Pushed to the off side
squeezed out to point with a languid back-foot push
very full, tailing into the toes and striking the pad, way down the leg side
shorter, wider, smashed with intent but no timing to backward point
full length, pushed back down the pitch, and half-stopped in the followthrough
clipped out to midwicket, a bit of indecision over the single
inswinger, two sounds as they go up for the lbw. Nothing doing
defended on the back foot into the off side
onto the front foot, and firmly driven. Head over the ball, good conviction in the stroke
back and across and defended to midwicket
good length ball at off stump, draws an outside edge which is well controlled and runs wide of the slips
whipped off the stumps, and it's a very strange leg-side field with a deep square and a deep midwicket
short of a length at off stump, flicked to midwicket
holds his bat inside the line of a good length delivery
full at off stump, dug out to mid-off
this nearly pops back to Stokes in his follow through, a short ball which takes the shoulder of the bat as he tries to turn it to the leg side
good shot, too full outside off, Powell gets a stride forward and drills it through the covers
drags the length back, pushed across outside off, left alone
short of a length at off stump, defended
good leave, this is reasonably close to off stump on a full length
too short outside off, driven from the back foot through the covers
on the stumps, defended into midwicket
full outside off, gets forward then holds his bat inside the line
a fraction shorter, again Hope does well not to have a nibble
short of a length, tickled fine down the leg side...in fact, he doesn't get any bat on it
fuller, at the stumps, worked to the leg side
this comes back significantly from outside off, back of a length, solidly defended
at off stump, defended
back of a length at middle and off, defended to cover
fuller, at the stumps, a sweetly-struck on-drive finds mid-on
angled across outside off, left alone
back of a length, at off stump, defended
that's a flat-footed drive, to a full ball outside off, the inside edge scoots down to fine leg
slips onto leg stump, Hope misses his flick and it takes pad to the leg side
lovely shot, full outside off, he leans forward and threads it through the gap between cover and mid-off
gets across to off stump and defends a full delivery to cover
that's a sharp bouncer! Hope has to be quick to get underneath it
and another, 87mph, perhaps a little bit shorter this time as he ducks
back on a fuller length, defended to midwicket
finds the outside edge with a length delivery outside off, goes to ground and wide of the slips
round the wicket, angled into the pads, deflects along the ground to Bairstow
good length at middle and off, defended to cover
top shot, take that! Full at off stump, driven straight back past Anderson. Lovely straight bat

what a ball! Anderson has pulled another out of the bag. What a gem to take 501. No half-century for Powell, and nothing he could do about it. Angles in from round the wicket, pitches around middle, zips off the seam to beat the bat and kiss the off bail. Doesn't get better from a fast bowler
has he tickled this down the leg side? A reasonable appeal from Bairstow, but Root decides not to review. Just clipped the thigh pad
full at off stump, defended
neatly flicked from outside off to deep square leg
very full outside off, driven through point so the new batsman gets off strike...scores now level
full at off stump, touches 90mph, defended to cover
a shorter delivery, he stays back in the crease and defends
short of a length outside off, solidly behind it
an inswinger, clipped off his hip to long leg
back of a length at off stump, hops into a defensive shot
touch short, outside off, left alone
nearly dragged on! Drives at a fuller delivery, well away from his body, but it scoots down to fine leg
the inswinger, Hope gets forward, takes the inside edge to the leg side
full at off stump, pushed to mid-off
onto the front foot and drives to mid-off
walks into a defensive shot which goes back down the pitch
huge appeal for lbw, a big inswinger, Hope fell across it. And England have called the review. Given not by Gaffaney. It's done too much, heading down the leg side (and a hit high, too)
a very compact drive between cover and mid-off
outside off, good length, left alone
plays inside the line, ball barely reaches Bairstow
comes forward and drives, skews into the leg side as he loses his shape a little
nearly has a nibble at this, back of a length outside off
play off the back foot, slightly away from his body, through backward point
full at off stump, that's the spot, defended to mid-off
and now Erasmus says not out to an lbw shout! England have called the review. Good length, nipped back. Going down? Looks like it on the first replay. Missing leg stump. That was an emotional review
beats him, short of a length outside off, climbs past Chase's outside edge
fuller, outside off, onto the front foot and defends
full, driven to mid-off
another pristine drive, gets a stride forward and punches through the line wide of mid-off
drags the length back, slides off the face through backward point
short of a length, outside off, defended to point
well played, pushes a length delivery into the covers and spots the chance of the single
a bouncer over leg stump which Chase ducks
starts with a wide half volley which is dispatched through the point area
responds with a bouncer which is leg side
good length outside off, nice carry through to the keeper
nips back from short of a length, beats the inside edge and takes a jumping Hope above the pads
fuller, outside off, left alone
this one is the inswinger, Hope watches it well and nudges to the leg side
extra bounce! Short of a length outside off, jumps at Hope who does very well to keep it down in front of gully
fuller, defended to the off side
angled in at off stump, defended towards point
full and straight, Anderson delivering from wide on the crease, punched firmly to mid-on
back of a length outside off, defended
works a length delivery to the leg side
full outside off, a jabby defensive shot which runs to gully
back of a length, defended to the off side
full and straight, driven down the on side of the pitch, Broad dives right across to try and intercept, mid-on can get across
a bouncer outside off, Bairstow leaps to take it
gets forward into a full delivery and drives to cover
poor ball to finish with, wide outside off, an easy leave
that's a good start! Full outside off, late movement away and it beats Hope's edge as he has a rather half-hearted push forward
straighter, flicked off around middle stump to long leg
full at middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
he's got an early one! That's what England wanted. In the channel outside off, Chase has a nibble and Bairstow takes the chance low down to his right
full down the leg side, has a flick at it and there's a click as he goes through to Bairstow...a muted appeal
back of a length at off stump, defended to the bowler
full outside off, 84mph, defended on the front foot
edged, but falls well short of second slip. That's part of Hope's skill, he doesn't push too hard in defence
nice carry through to Bairstow from a full length, Hope holds his bat inside the line...hint of movement back in
good length outside off, he's across the crease and defends
fuller, outside off, left alone
full again, Hope resists having a drive, leaves it alone. Broad starts with a maiden
leading edge! But just wide of mid-off. Blackwood aiming to work a full delivery to the leg side, closes the face
pushes at a short-of-a-length delivery, into midwicket...for Hope's soft hands, read Blackwood's hard hards
that's a good 'un...movement away from around off stump, Blackwood not getting a big stride forward and is beaten
touch shorter in length, defended on the back foot to midwicket
fuller at off stump, block on the front foot
short of a length at off stump, bunted to mid-off...eight dot balls to Blackwood
full at off stump, pushed to mid-on
keeps it full, Hope onto the front foot and plays to mid-on again
drags the length back, outside off, seam movement away and Hope shadows the ball rather than playing
nips back from just short of a good length, takes Hope high on the pads. An appeal for lbw but that didn't look right
good line, just outside off, back of a length and skims past the edge. Hope doing well not to push at it
he played at this one, came forward and the ball just straightened a touch off the seam to beat him
squares him up at off stump, takes the outside edge through point and he's off the mark

dropped! Another one down in a series of shelled chances...Broad at mid-off. Blackwood came forward to drive, wasn't to the pitch, came from low down on the bat and that was pretty simple to Broad's right
back of a length at off stump, defended
short of a length, pushed to mid-on
this shapes back in from outside off, punched from the back foot to mid-off
angled into the pads, he misses his flick and it trickles through to Bairstow
full outside off, 84mph, driven to mid-off
pulls the length back, Hope doesn't play at it
onto the front foot and pushed to mid-off
seam movement from back of a length, gets squared up as he defends
full, outside off, he plays forward and puts his bat behind the pad
on the stumps, nips back, defended to the leg side
straight delivery, worked to midwicket
that's a ripper! Good length, nips away off the seam, beats the edge and travels over off stump
short of a length, pushed off the back foot to mid-off
touch fuller, he continues to hang back, played to mid-off
on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
punched off the back foot to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, runs into the leg side
short of a length outside off, 87mph, played off the back foot

given lbw, but Blackwood has reviewed straight away. Sounded like an edge. Was a fuller delivery. Well, well. Was it two pads? Erasmus gave it on field, remember. There is a little squiggle as it passes the bat, and the third umpire overturns it
good follow-up! Jags away from short of a length, climbs past the edge to Bairstow
swings at a full, straight delivery and it skews through the leg side
full outside off, a solid block on the front foot
short of alength at off stump, defended

gone this time! And it's a fourth for Anderson. The pressure pays off against Blackwood. Short of a length, touch wider outside off, Blackwood plays away from his body and it's another grab for Bairstow
good delivery, full outside off, curving away and left alone
straighter delivery, worked to the leg side
full outside off, left alone
shuffles across to off stump and defends slightly uncertainly to point
full outside off, through to the keeper
gets into an awkward position against a well-directed short ball, is in two minds whether to duck or play and ends up having a late waft at it
angled into the pads, takes the thigh guard and scoots away fine
back outside off, left alone
on the stumps, some late movement in, tucked to deep square leg
full outside off, 87mph, left alone
good length angled in at off stump, defended to cover
short of a length outside off, keeps his bat well inside the line as he has done this morning
almost! Fuller, spooned in the air as he's a little stuck trying to get forward, just out of reach of the short mid-off who has recently been brought in
a bouncer outside off
another good one at off stump, nips away from short of a length and beats the edge
a touch wider, he doesn't play
full outside off, 86mph, pushed into the covers
full at the stumps, doesn't get very hard forward, defended to mid-off
a bit more of a stride forward this time, defends a full delivery
back of a length, at middle and off, defended to midwicket
no short leg, as so often! Nips back off a good length, jags in at Dowrich, takes the inside edge and balloons to the leg side
dropped, but a tough one for Broad! Pushes forward at a full delivery, bat twists, the ball travels to Broad's left and he tries to grab it with a full stretch to his left
that's a good shot, a shorter ball outside off, strong pull to deep square leg
full outside off, moves away, he's able to leave alone
short of a length, defended towards point
outside off, just short of a good length, defended to the covers
fuller, at off stump, takes the outside edge but goes to ground wide of the packed slip cordon...kept his hands reasonably soft
shorter, prodded to the off side
bouncer directed nicely into the batsman, but he's quick to duck
short ball, down leg side and a big leap form Bairstow, one-handed
beauty. Slants it in towards the corridor, gets it to straighten off a length. Well beaten
short, too wide, left alone

Broad screams as he runs down the wicket, absolutely convinced he's got Hope lbw. His enthusiasm not matched by anyone else. His opinion not matched by the umpire. Hope trapped on the back foot, but it hit him high on the back leg after nipping in
back of a length at off stump, anxiously defended off the outside half
nicely floated up outside off stump, not quite to the pitch as he drives but it dribbles away through cover
good length, climbs in at his hip as he fends at it. Cops it on the back thigh
good length at off stump, no feet, pushed to extra cover
full outside off, toe-ended bunt to extra cover
full at leg stump, mistimed on-drive. Skewed to mid-on's left
back of a length at the pads, whipped to deep square
short one outside off, looks to drag it with a pull. Well away from the body. Under-edged to square leg
back of a length outside off, slight deviating away off the pitch, but too wide for him to chase
good length, angled in at off stump, watchfully defended
length outside off, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, solidly pushed to mid-on
connects on the pull this time. Straight through in the corridor, short and he transfers the weight towards third man to hoick this to the midwicket boundary
back of a length outside off, withdraws the bat to let it pass
good length, in at the pads. Tapped to deep square with the angle
back of a length at off stump, defended back down the pitch
back of a length outside off, pokes it through point and takes off, only to be sent back. Only to then see backward point make a hash of it and parry it towards the boundary. Gets hi run
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
nicely timed drive, but straight to extra cover. Leaned into this length ball outside off
length at off stump, angled in. Defended very very late off the back foot
oh well bowled. Wide of the crease, angle at off stump and then some bounce as it straightens past the outside edge

harmless lob to short mid-on. Been happy to go with that pull shot, but this time he's paid the price. Similar ball to the last one. Climbs off a length. This shot is attempted on the angle. But it straightens to find the sticker of the bat and it's a slice in the end
back of a length into the pads, shovelled to deep square
length and into the pads, whipped to deep square
plays inside the line as this slants into the corridor, beaten on the outside edge
back of a length outside off, stabbed to point with an open face
early on the pull and it chips off the bottom of the bat. Lands short of extra cover. Was wide outside off, not quite there for a full
leaps off the floor as this climbs awkwardly into him from a length. Ends up exposing the leg stump as he attempts a glance. Deflects fine off the hip
bouncer outside off, left alone
short on at the ribs, doesn't quite zip off the surface. Easily on top of the bounce to defend
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
gorgeous cover drive, straight to short extra. Big reach gets him to the pitch, but placement lacking
back of a length at middle stump, tucked to square leg with a closed face
back of a length in the corridor, defended late off the back foot, into the cordon
back of a length outside off, skids through at knee height as he fishes off the back foot. Beaten
back of a length in the corridor, thick outside edge fielded by a diving fourth slip
back of a length outside off, guided wide of fourth slip and quickly sent back as he looks to steal a single
bouncer, too short, ducks it as it flies past his left shoulder
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
nicely done. Leans in to the full one outside off. Not quite to the pitch but he uses his wrists to adjust. Opens the face, gets it low on the bat, but it's a classy cover drive
back of a length at leg stump, flicked between deep square and fine leg. Former does well to release it quickly
back of a length outside off, pushed on the up to cover
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot

oh this guy can play. Glorious shot through midwicket. This is back of a length at off stump. He's in the air to get on top of the bounce and then he whips at it to get it wide of mid-on to bring up his fifty
back of a length outside off, left alone
and more class. Full outside off, reaches out to it and slices it uppishly, but he was in control, Gets it to backward point's right
back of a length at off stump, tucked to mid-on off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
goes full and into off stump. Hope brings an angled bat down, very late, to keep it out
length ball, skids through outside off and past his forward block
good length outside off, slashes at it languidly...and it runs to the point boundary. Not in control as this skids through. Slices it
back of a length outside off, left alone. This jumps at Bairstow
full outside off, still no spin. Drives and he's beaten on the outside edge
back of a length outside off, punched to long-on off the back foot
length outside off, big stride to punch this to mid-off
good length at leg stump. Holder comfortable on the back foot as he punched this straight to square leg
length at middle stump, poked to midwicket on the up
bounce as it nips in from outside off. Holder fends, gets it into the leg side off the inside edge
good length outside off, pushes on the up against the angle. Bunted down the pitch off the inside half
back of a length, corridor, punched to mid-off
full at off stump, pushed to mid-on off the inside half
back of a length at middle, can't nudge this past midwicket
length at middle stump, punched to mid-on off the back foot
good length outside off, lets it slide
back of a length at leg stump, flicked to deep square
full at off stump, forward block
back of a length outside off, lets it go
good length, slides through at off. Gets inside the line with the defence. As a result, gets a thick outside edge past slip
tossed up outside off, pushed to point off the toe-end
full and drifting away from off, nicely forward to get to the pitch and beat cover's dive
good length outside off, punched to cover
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler

dropped. Gully has put it down. Put there specifically for the big Holder drive. He chases them compulsively outside off and there's been no spin today. Slides through and takes the outside edge. Cook is struck on the shin, cannot get down quickly enough
full at off stump, driven to short mid-off
short of a length, knocked into midwicket
a good one, nips back off the seam from short of a length and beats the inside edge
fuller, at middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
and now this one moves away, more lovely stuff from Anderson, although Holder playing well away from his body
full and straight, defended
short of a length, pushing through the line and it runs into the leg side off a thick inside edge
full outside off, nicely onto the front foot and driven to cover
at off stump, defended to the covers
touch wider, full, left alone
through the keeper...ball not doing that much for Broad now
that's loose, pushing off the back foot well away from his body at quite a wide short-of-a-length delivery

another beauty, what a ball to get your fifth wicket! Doesn't come much better for a swing bowler. Pitches on off stump, just short of a good length, shapes away and kisses the outside edge through to Bairstow
round the wicket, good length outside off, defended
that's gone as well! He has six. Full at off stump from round the wicket, Bishoo not really in line, but it's another fantastic delivery which scoots past the outside edge to hit off stump
full at off stump, Roach across to hit and the ball slides off the face into point
full outside off, he pushes forward, ball runs off the face behind point...Anderson's smile vanishes again!
wider outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, takes an inside edge down to long leg...that works for West Indies
full outside off, left alone
good shot, drives a full delivery between cover and mid-off...big chase by Stoneman but he can't reach it. Lovely timing
onto the front foot, defended to the covers
another good-looking drive, wide of cover, but this time mid-off gets across with a dive...but it means just one ball left for Roach
pushed down the leg side, wasted
another beauty, full outside off, brings him forward then scoots past the edge
beaten again, feeling for this outside off
three in a row, Holder playing forward, quite a wide delivery, beaten on the outside edge
bigger stride this time, pushes a full delivery out to deep cover
gets across to a straight delivery and it takes an inside edge to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, defended towards point
a bouncer, travels over Roach's back
fends away this short ball, flies wide of the keeper down to fine leg...came off the elbow. Lead over 100
fuller, angled into the batsman, takes the thigh pad to the leg side
full outside off, solidly forward and defends to cover
big appeal for lbw as this nips back off a good length, Erasmus says not out. Struck him above the pad
fuller, at the stumps, he keeps it out with a push to mid-on
shapes in from a full length, driven to mid-on
outside off, good length, defended to the covers
full at leg stump, clipped off the pads down to long leg which is vacant
back on off stump, hint of shape in, defended on the walk to the bowler
short of a length, worked to mid-on
tucked from off stump into the leg side, mid-on can't stop the single so he keeps the strike

he's gone now. Tries to take a short ball over the leg side, gets underneath it, the ball comes off the splice - perhaps a touch quicker than he expected - and lobs a simple catch to Anderson coming round from mid-on. The great pair combine

given caught behind! Gabriel has called the review. Did this take the inside edge. Good length ball which nips back. Not sure he's hit this. Seems to have clipped the back pad. He survives the king pair
full and straight, keeps it out with a block
a bouncer, angled down the leg side
short of a length, misses the bat and takes him high on the leg
good length at off stump, defended. He sees out the over
he's done it! That's his career best. A full delivery, moves back to beat Roach's inside edge and crashes into middle stump. A display of masterful deliveries ends with another
not a good started, pushed miles down the leg side, evades the diving keeper and it's byes to fine leg
that's much better! Good length at off stump, Cook squared up by seam movement, takes the back leg on the way towards slip. Given leg bye, but he nicked it
lovely shot, full at off stump, Stoneman comes forward and drills an on-drive straight of mid-on
drags the length back, angled in at off stump, defended
good length, defended on the front foot to cover
more nice timing, gets inside the line and works this from around middle and off through square leg
he's in a positive frame of mind, gets forward and drives a full delivery square through the covers
over-adjusts, pushes this down the leg side
